TopicTitle: Rediscovery: Now in Graphic Novel Style! (Chapter 18)

Articles.Content:
It had been 12 years since the 7th Kerbin War ended. 14 years since the space program ended.  Kerbals have always had a habit of worldwide conflicts, having fought 5 in the last 50 years. But this war was different, it was worse. Massive armadas of ships were deployed only for a handful to return. In the end, the Kefrican Federation won, but at what cost? Retired director of the old Space Program John Kerman brings the old kerbonauts and scientists back together, but with the economy in ruins and almost a decade of work destroyed, will they be able to succeed in bringing Kerbalkind to space? 

This is a story/mission report with a lot of Forgotten Space Program Influence,  but is kinda based on my old, dead version 1.11 career.

Modlist:

Enjoy the story!

Seems really interesting, let me just follow this
Sorry for the long hiatus because i have been working on my new planet mod. It should start by the 23 of december.

Chapter 1: A great start

John Kerman banked his single-seater electric plane as it approached the launch site. He felt lucky to have bought one of those before the war started.

He lined up his plane for landing, buzzing the makeshift headquarters/ launch tower, touching down on the parched sand.

After parking his plane, John took a seat in the launch tower.

"And liftoff of the Sounder 1!"

"using spin-stability"

"The radar on the plane detects a piece of debris, the rocket seemed to survive the crash" John said

"A great start to the space program"

 

Edited December 23, 2021 by Watermel00n

Chapter 2: Old parts, new mission

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Year 1 Day 67

We could do this for a long time.

Before the war started, the KSP stocked up on 50 units of the mass-produced XLV-2 launch vehicle, Rockomax's most used launch vehicle, featuring the usual core and two SRBs. Now, Rockomax Industries has shut down, and we have to maintain the rockets ourselves. The public, however, doesn't approve of using these launch systems. In my opinion, as long as we knew how to keep the rockets in good condition, we are fine. 

Yesterday I met up with the CEO of AtomicTech Inc, a rising company in post-war aerospace, A.T. Kerman.  I have been working closely with him to see if AT Inc could reverse engineer the XLV-2 using their Junkyard™ technology. I haven't seen any success yet. For now, we will have to rely on our 50 remaining rockets.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Year 1 Day 74

That's record speed!

The KSP has been able to mash together two Duna probes, an asteroid capture system, a minmus lander and a D2 service module to make the KORV Hunter - in only 5 days!. (that's Kerbin Orbit Rendezvous Vehicle, Diary) It should be able to rendezvous with the Hope Orbital Research Platform and still have fuel left to explore some anomalous space junk. I went to the Gene Kerman Space Observatory yesterday and was able to capture an image of XLA-1 (eXtra Large Anomaly 1). It seemed to be long and spindly, and rapidly spinning. It would be nice if the Hunter could explore that.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

___________________________________________________________________________________

Y1D75

KORV launch on a XLV-2

"Mission control,  we have a clean booster separation and on the way to orbit" John heard Sudos' voice on the radio, and breathed a sigh of relief. The launch had been stressful at least and nerve-wracking at worst. The moral of the story was simple - Old computers don't work well with new software. Sudos, Anlorf and Kathbert knew that perfectly well. The outdated K+2 system lagged every time an adjustment was made. Luckily, Sudos and Kathbert were both pilots and could correct the trajectory manually - in a fairing. Without a proper escape system or parachutes, the crew would have to bail out and land by personal paraglider if it was necessary. 

"Clean stage sep" squeaked Anlorf. Yes, John and Anlorf were old friends from kerbegarten. Anlorf was always a  "scaredy-kat" and was scared by everything. Everything. John still wondered why he was chosen for this dangerous mission.

3 mins later

Everything had gone well, stage seperation, boosters, orbit insertion, and now it was time for the real challenge. Rendezvous with a laggy computer and a target on shutdown mode. Grabbing the Hope Orbital Research Platform.

20 mins later

Approaching HORP

Detached 2nd stage, preparing grappler

Slowly forwards...

"Mission control, we have a solid dock," Kathbert calmly mumbled, contrary to the situation in the Mission control: Chairs were being overturned! Staff dancing on tables! Coffee getting thrown by staff into other's faces!

We have entered a new age,  John thought, sipping his coffee despite the chaos in the room

And he was right.

Chapter 3: Like peas in a pod

Year 1 Day 80

While the crew of the Hunter were getting all systems on Hope Station online, the KSP planning team were planning. Planning for big dreams. But to compete the plan, the KSP needed a new, compact pod.

Enter the K2. Produced by Castor-Pollux Industries, the K2 could squeeze two kerbals in a 1.25 pod. It could ferry kerbals to stations and beyond. But first, it had to test its abort sequence because safety first.(mostly)

After much shaking, the K2 finally slid off the Jeb's Junkyard Hammer Booster, despite the booster thurst being turned down to 60%.

The test did not go as planned, but the KSP had not given up on the K2 yet... 

Edited March 15, 2022 by Watermel00n

Chapter 4: KOOSE on deck!

Year 1 Day 80

Launch of the KOOSE(Kerbal Out Of Space Easiest) Escape pod Hub

Deployment of payload

Rendezvous with Hope Station 

Slowing down to stationkeeping

Coming in with the help of Kathbert to guide the Hub in.

Docked! The crew of Hope Station are much, much safer now.

Chapter 5:  Boring stuff number 1

A large electric plane is tested.

The K2 command pod passes safety regulations

Jeb goes back to the KSC... in that.

A budget resupply mission is launched on the K2 launch system, while simultaneously testing a new service bay. That's Morty the budget kerbal at his best! 

The Hunter "steals" the fuel from the KOOSE second stage. It's now ready to explore the strange Anomaly XLA-001!

Background info #1

KE - Krater Expedition (you'll see later)

Evolution of kerbals +first civilisation

Spoiler

230000 BKE - Kerbals evolve 

180000 BKE - Kerbals use stone weapons

170000 BKE - Kerbals hunt large prey

100000 BKE - Kerbals make fire

76000 BKE - Kerbals build first underground shelters to hide from the meteorites that hit from 76000 BKE - 69000 BKE

50000 BKE - First cave art found. Kerbals still live primarily underground

34000 BKE - First civilization found, the Kerbonian Cave Kingdom. Housing was underground and farming was done on the surface.

30000 BKE - Kerbonians wiped out by barbarians.

Kerbland Republic

Spoiler

30300 BKE - Kerbonian caves inhabited by the Kerbish, who make the first republic. They elect 5 councils who vote on decisions.

28000 BKE - Kerbish caves expand to present - day Kerfrica. Wheels invented.

27900 BKE - The Great Bluetown fire breaks out, suffocating ~6000 kerbals.

27800 BKE - Kerbish revolution breaks out. All 5 councilkerbs are executed.

27790 BKE - Kerbish state of Oklon separates from Kerbland to make the Oklon republic. War breaks out.

27750 BKE - Kerbland-Oklon war ends. Meanwhile, Keroocians attack from the north.

27730 BKE - Keroocian scientists discover gunpowder and cannons. They take multiple Kerbish forts in the north.

27690 BKE - Bunwed, the second largest city in  Kerbland surrenders. Kerbish escape to Roundria.

27680 BKE - Kerbland falls. Dark ages begin.

Industial Ages

Spoiler

10000 BKE - Kerblish sail to Kermaria with a fleet of 56, but only 22 reach their destination due to storms.

4000 BKE - Kerblish establish many cities in Kermaria

3000 BKE - Kerblish and Keroocians discover coal at around the same time.

1000 BKE - 99% of kerbals live underground. Kerbals have evolved bigger eyes to see underground. Iron found by Keroocians.

231 BKE - Kermarians steal the secret of how to smelt iron in an epic heist.

143 BKE - Kermarians invent first steam engine, is widely used.

98 BKE - Steam train invented in Kermaria, runs along underground tunnel.

2 BKE - Steam carts invented.

1 AKE - The Krater expedition starts. Krew must wear special eyewear to avoid permanent eye damage from the sun.

25 AKE - Krater expedition ends. Discovery of many species of grass. Desertlands discovered.

67 AKE - Sea salt is widely used to season food. Saltville founded, supplies over 60% of Kerbalkind's salt.

120 AKE - Kerblish drive over the the Desertlands and sail up the Kile river. First contact with Keroocians.

125 AKE - Kerblish trade with Keroocians and both nations benefit.

140 AKE - 80% of Kerbals live underground.

153 AKE - 20 ships from Keroocia sail to the Kervon sea, starts colony.

167 AKE - Kervon colony fights for independence.

171 AKE - Kervon is now a nation and is kommunist.

179 AKE - Kervon has a population of 6 millon kerbals out of 50 million kerbinwide.

200 AKE - Kervon and Kermaria disagree about the Koot peninsula, well known to be a good spot for gold mines.

Kerbin wars 1-4

Spoiler

201 AKE - Kervon declares war on Kermaria. 1st Kerbin War starts.

207 AKE - Kermarians driven out of Koot by the Kervonian navy.

209 AKE - Kermarians surrender. Kervonians take Koot. Total deaths: ~120000 kerbals

213 AKE - Kermaria launches surprise attack on Kruh Island in the Koot peninsula. 2nd Kerbin war starts. 

215 AKE - Kervonians destroy more than 90% of the Kermarian navy, surrender. Total deaths: ~32000 kerbals.

250 AKE - Oil is widely used. 50% oil comes from the Kery Coast. High prices are charged on Keroocia.

259 AKE - Keroocia invents planes.

261 AKE - Keroocia bombs the Kermarias, 3rd Kerbin war starts.

267 AKE - 3rd Kerbin War ends with a stalemate. Total deaths: ~50000 kerbals

268 AKE - Roundria declares independence from Kermaria, situation with Keroocia too tense for Kermaria to care.

269 AKE - 4th Kerbin War starts. Roundria launches first probe.

272 AKE - 4th  Kerbin War ends with a stalemate. Total deaths ~43000. Roundria sends first probe to orbit.

276 AKE - 5th Kerbin War starts. Roundria send kerbal to orbit, space station and mun probe. Kerblish space initiative Kerbin Space Exploitation Company starts 

278 AKE - Fearing Roundria would side with the Keroocians and orbitally bomb Kermaria, Kermaria  takes Roundria by force. All rockets are destroyed.

...

History's not done yet, to be continued

Chapter 6: The Anomaly

Year 1 Day 99

Hunter sets off on its first anomaly mission with Sudos and Kathbert.

"I'm scaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaared!!!!!! I'm aloooooooooooooooooooooone!!!!!!!!!!!!" Anlorf shouted as he saw the Hunter disappear from view.  

"Calm down Anlorf, you can run the station by yourself" said Kathbert as she activated the two "Terrier" orbital maneuvering engines.

But soon, the casual trip would turn into a nightmare.

"Mission Control we have a bit of a problem with the electricity" Kathbert reported.

"It's too late to turn back now, you're almost at the anomaly. Anyways, you can always reenter and bail back to Kerbin." replied John. From the tone of his voice, it seemed very serious.

"Mission control Rendezvous burn complete, burning towards XLA-1" Sudos said while activating the RCS.

As they drifted closer, Kathbert peered out of her window and exclaimed

"Mission Control, are you seeing what I'm seeing?"

"Come on Kathbert, get ready for docki- errrr, grabbing.

After a minute spent trying to grab the defunct station or whatever it was, the Hunter had arrived.

Using RCS, the Hunter stabilised the Anomaly and Sudos EVAed into the Anomaly.

"It's dark in here, let me turn on the lights- WHOA! Look at these scorch marks on the walls! Better send these pics over to Mission Control." Sudos examined the airlock and command module. 

Sudos snapped on the lights and life support while Kathbert EVAed over.

In the cupola, Sudos and Kathbert radioed Anlorf.

"So everything's okay?" Sudos spoke first.

"I've-'ve been hiding in this escape-ape pod for 2 hours..."

Chapter 7: Project Rediscovery

Year 1 Day 102

John Kerman looked at the ambitious plan ahead of the KSP. ...build long-term bases on the Mun and Minmus... 

...build a long-range deep space fleet...

...send regular missions to Kerbin orbit...

Year 1 Day 105

The first K2 pod for Project Rediscovery launches for a "simple" crew transfer.

"WHOOHOO WE'RE GOING TO SPAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACE!"

"Jeb stop yelling! You're going to deafen Mission Control."

"Bill stop worrying! We're back in space again! WHEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE..."

"mission control can i have permission to eva jeb without a spacesuit?"

"Yippee! WE'RE IN ORBIT!"

"my earssssss"

Later

"Here anlorfy... come out, come out, wherever you are!"

"Jeb stop being weird..."

"HELP MISSION CONTROL THIS IS ANLORF AND I NEED HELP! JEB IS GOING INSANE!"

"come on, when I was your age I didn't have an escape rocket..."

After an EVA transfer, Anlorf fired the "Terrier" and headed down.

"AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH MY SHIPS ON FIRE HELP HELP HELP"

"when I was your age..."

"Hey, why isn't Anlorf responding?" Bobak, the oldest mission control asked.

"I think he fainted..."

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

...colonise Duna...

...explore the Jool system...

Big dreams.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

EDIT:

Year 1 Day 101

The crew of the Hunter leave the Anomaly which was found to be Duna Spaceport, dating back to AKE 177. (current is AKE 211) 

Duna Spaceport was found to be produced by KSEC, after finding multiple flags in the interior cabin and airlock.

Scientists believe that Duna Spaceport was lost due to an electrical fire in the computer system, simultaneously knocking out communications.

Thus, Duna Spaceport was not able to leave Kerbin Orbit. Historians had already found newspapers pointing to the failure of the expensive Spaceport as the cause of KSEC going bankupt.

Hope Orbital Research Platform

Population: 4

 

Edited March 22, 2022 by Watermel00n

Chapter 8: The Roadtrip

Year 1 Day 110

There was a knock at the door of the Mission control.

"Yes?"

"Good morning John Kerman, I'm Albert Kerman from Kerbin Broadcasting Network Corporation."

"Nice to meet you, but who are those kerbals beside you?"

"Those are Mauvey Kerman(pilot), Handrin Kerman(engineer), Joevin Kerman(engineer) and Newbas Kerman(scientist)."

"Ah i see. So what have you come here for?"

"We want to send them and that rover, the Grindstone Mk9 to the Mun. And make a TV show of them circumnavigating the Mun by ground."

"You-you mean an Elcano?"

"Yes, and I need you to send it there. We'll cover the launch costs."

"It's a deal."

Chapter 9: The Elcano begins

Thanks to @18Watt for this amazing challenge!

I will be attempting a Mun circumnavigation (full stock)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Joevin Kerman, Assistant Engineer on the Grindstone's Log Book 

Year 1 Day 122-123

Getting to orbit

Spoiler

Easy launch with those big fins. Little dark in that fairing though. Can't believe those folks at the KSC could put this together so fast. (yes, i uninstalled all the mods)

Clean booster sep.

Cruising to Apoapsis. Kerbin usually looks better than this but we had to install Elcanic Camera Viewer for us to qualify as stock.

Picture from my camera

Going to Mun

Spoiler

Leaving for Mun

It gets bigger...

and bigger...

Orbit insertion.

Landing (scary!)

Suborbital

AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH

phew

Us in the Grindstone. Let's go!

Mauvey plants the flag. It's time to start the Elcano!

Roles on our ship:

Chapter 10: (Elcano) Bumps and a "tiny scratch"

Year 1 Day 123
 

Start of Elcano (Elcano Marker 1) - Pit Stop 1

Spoiler

Down a hill broke a wheel

We love flats!

I spilt my coffee!

Going up a crater with rocket assistance. 

PIT STOP! Handrin fixes a solar panel and the wheel.

Handrin: Let's go! Joevin! You go in the front!

Me: YAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAY!

Pit Stop 1 -Elcano Marker 2

Spoiler

I get to ride in the back cockpit since Handrin's shift is over! Yay! Much better view here

Trying to avoid the crater

OOPS!

AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH

After almost 5 minutes trying to get out of the crater and a very awkward TV moment, we decide to use the rockets to get out of the crater.

Newman: Nice rock can i have?

Mauvey: ......no.

Not sure if we'll have enough kits for the journey.

I fixed the wheels and now Handrin sits in the front. Luckily in the back we can secretly take the snacks.

Newman: don't let them hear us

Me: *farts*

Newman: did your fart just break that tire?

Me: *blush* i hope not...

Handrin: let's not fix that tire, so we can save kits.

Me: Ouch that hurt!

Newman: I heard some explosions!

Mauvey: the fuel cell blew, plus the back lights

Newman: did you fart again?

Mauvey: Not again...

Mauvey: luckily this rover can flip back up

Handrin: you're such a good pilot

Mauvey: ah yes I am

 

Group photo and a bit of a TV moment. I got to plant the flag!

Handrin: It's dinner time! Wait, who took my snacks?

Me: *farts*

Handrin: *glares*

Very reminiscent of my own; comedically large fairing, and something always looks very odd when it pops off because of the way you have a rocket that ends in a vehicle. I fear in real space programs "land on the tail and fall over sideways" isn't an approved technique. :-)

How does the self-righting mechanism work, please?
Reaction wheels

Me: ummmmmmmmm...
